result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter E Baxter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges to apply for work, if applicable.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause. No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Undergo random urine screens.  No contact with Kenlawrence A., Cammeron E., Demonn W.
Obtain AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, any cash bail to apply.  If defendant fails to pay the monetary amounts on time, then a judgement is to be entered aginst the defendant for the unpaid balance.  Collection can then also proceed under sec. 71.935 of the Stats. as well as other collection procedures. Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor at any time in the future - sec. 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes all requirements of probation within the required period of time.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Walter E Baxter
Current: N113W15395 Francese Drive, Apt. A, Germantown, WI 53022-3440 United States  (Effective: 09-03-2015)
Prior: 6647 North 83rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
(x ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  12-07-2014      Initials:  sm

Defendant Walter E Baxter in court with attorney Gary E Rosenthal.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges to apply for work, if applicable; credit for 2 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 months with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
- No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- No contact with Kenlawrence A., Cammeron E., Demonn W.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, any cash bail to apply.  If defendant fails to pay the monetary amounts on time, then a judgement is to be entered aginst the defendant for the unpaid balance.  Collection can then also proceed under sec. 71.935 of the Stats. as well as other collection procedures.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor at any time in the future - sec. 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
- Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes all requirements of probation within the required period of time.
- Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement and Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letters for sentencing received and filed./ds

Court orders the defendant to the public defender's office forthwith for appointment of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
